intro: Linaria fragilis var. aequiloba, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb with slender, branching stems and bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family, and bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in disturbed habitats and gardens.
